creditline: Gift of funds from Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Funerary Urn, Yang shao culture, Ma-chang type, earthenware with black and purple painted decor, two handles. Decor unusual in showing two stylized kneeling figures between cross-hatched circles.
medium:
Ma-chang type
Earthenware with painted decor
text: The seemingly abstract zigzag designs on the burial storage jar are a stylized version of a human-like stick figure. The neck of the jar in this case represents the head. Built from coils of clay, the vessel relates in shape to the earlier Panshan (2600-2300 b.c.) jars shown here, but its proportions are more elongated and its surface is matt and unburnished. Related Mazhang (2200-2000 b.c.) type jars have been excavated in Gansu and Qinghai provinces in northwest China.
title: Funerary Storage Jar
